messages.message: Hey! What’s the best way for pulling in IB Python libs into a Docker image currently? Alternatively, do we have prebaked images that we can use for running unit tests for SolEng packages that depend on e.g `instabase.provenance`? Tried some experiments using the `celery-app-tasks` image a while back but didn’t get too far
You should be able to use that dockerfile, you’d most likely change the entry point and then just launch into python directly
I have used that build folder locally on my laptop with success

Oh that’s good to hear other folks have had success with it - I’ll try it again for this testing environment then when I pick it back up :slightly_smiling_face:

When I used it before, I was able to looking to launch it as a VSCode Development container and was able to launch it fine but couldn’t get VSCode to register the `instabase` libraries (anything that lived under special celery workspace)
You have to set the sys.path to include the build folder
Perfect, thank you - I’ll report back on this case :slightly_smiling_face: hopefully can do something similar for VSCode environment too
If you have all the python dep installed via pip you should be able to use it in there. You’ll need thrift to run make build .

Perfect, thank you - once this is working, I’ll see if there’s a lighter solution we can use for development so that packages only need to install their own dependencies and not depend on all the IB libs, but a few other tasks would be needed for that to work
